New Records: Manuel Neuer made his 38th appearance at a major competition, the joint-most for Germany alongside Bastian Schweinsteiger.
This was also Manuel Neuer's 19th appearance at the Euros, taking him past Schweinsteiger’s 18.
Key Match Events: Nico Schlotterbeck's goal was ruled out for an infringement in the box.
Joachim Andersen's goal was ruled out for offside.
Kai Havertz scored a penalty after Joachim Andersen was penalized for handball.
Jamal Musiala scored a superb curling strike to secure Germany's win.
The match was halted due to a thunderstorm and resumed after the weather cleared.
Post-Match Reflections: Ange Postecoglou defended referee Michael Oliver after VAR decisions influenced the match.
Roy Keane criticized the handball decision, expressing sympathy for defenders.
Ian Wright expressed dissatisfaction with the handball and offside decisions.
Ange Postecoglou commented on the tight offside call and the use of technology in refereeing.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was briefly suspended due to a thunderstorm.
Germany have won three of their four games at Euro 2024, as many as in their previous 12 games across major competitions.
Denmark have failed to win any of their last eight games at major competitions.
Others: Jamal Musiala's performance was highlighted as crucial for Germany's win.
Christina Unkel, an American rules analyst, provided insight during ITV's coverage of Euro 2024.
